Description: Rectangular fragment of ivory inlay: broken at each end, decorated with a pattern of incised diagonal lines. The pattern forms a series of diamond-shaped lozenges along the length of the piece, each bounded by three parallel lines and having a circular depression in the centre. Many of the grooves are pattern filled with dark pigment.
Curator's comments: For pieces with the same pattern, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XXXVIII, 69-70, II; XL, 57, 60; XLI, 6; XLII, 10, 12, 26-7; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens II (Berlin, 1929-31), no. 314 and pl. 36; P. Montet, 'Kêmi' 8 (1946), pl.V; H. S. Baker, 'Furniture in the Ancient World' (London, 1966), 29, fig.16. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.XL, 59.
